topic.title: Setting Up The Saxon Transformer Factory Configuration
topic.shortdesc: If the Open-Toolkit-managed Java class path is not used or is not configured correctly for some reason then you must set the Java javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory system property to point to the i18n library's transformer factory. If you are using the Java library outside of the Open Toolkit, you will need to manage the Saxon configuration as described here.

body.note: You should not need to do this when running the Open Toolkit normally via the command line.
body.p: The value of the javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory Java system property must be "org.ditacommunity.i18n.saxon.DCI18nSaxonTransformerFactoryImpl91" (plug-in version 1.0) or org.ditacommunity.i18n.saxon.DCI18nSaxonTransformerFactoryImpl (plug-in version 2.0). The DCI18nSaxonTransformerFactoryImpl91 class is in the dita-community-i18n-saxon.jar jar file in the i18n plugin's lib/ directory. This jar is automatically included in the Open Toolkit's Java class path by the i18n Open Toolkit plugin.
How you set this property depends on how you run the Open Toolkit (toolkit versions 1.8.5 and 2.x onlyâ€”OT 3.3 and later is automatically configured).

If you are running the Open Toolkit from the command line or in a command environment, such as through a continuous integration server or through a CCMS, you can set an environment variable or you can set the javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory property as part of the Ant command invocation. See .

If you are running the Open Toolkit from oXygenXML you need to modify transformation scenarios to use Saxon 9.1 rather than later versions and set the javax.xml.transform.TransformerFactory property. See .
